issues.title: Order tags numerically instead of lexicographically
issues.body:
Right now the branch/tag list shows up as:
```
master
v1.0.10
v1.0.11
v1.0.12
v1.0.8
v1.0.9
```
Preferably they'd be displayed numerically descending:
```
master
v1.0.12
v1.0.11
v1.0.10
v1.0.9
v1.0.8
```
[MDN: String.prototype.localeCompare()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/localeCompare)

issues.title: Merged icon url interpreted by ZeroNet as merger url
issues.body:
The url `1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/img/pr-merged-white.svg` is interpreted as a merger url by ZeroNet:

```
Err: Exception: Invalid merger path: img/pr-merged-white.svg in UiServer.py line 118 > UiRequest.py line 189 > disabled-Multiuser/MultiuserPlugin.py line 64 > UiPluginManager/UiPluginManagerPlugin.py line 33 > UiConfig/UiConfigPlugin.py line 20 > ContentFilter/ContentFilterPlugin.py line 232 > UiRequest.py line 367 > NameYo/UiRequestPlugin.py line 24 > TranslateSite/TranslateSitePlugin.py line 35 > FilePack/FilePackPlugin.py line 111 > UiRequest.py line 602 > MergerSite/MergerSitePlugin.py line 249 > 52
```

pull_requests.title: Sort branches, tags and releases
pull_requests.body:
Branches are sorted lexicographically and always appear before tags.

Tags are sorted numerically inversed. This is not ideal in cases where tags use non-numerical names, but as this is how most people use tags I think it's worth it.

Releases are still sorted by date, but now descending so that the most recent release is on top.
